info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 7:09PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Chester and southeastern Union Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 709 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Union, or 4 miles northwest of Carlisle, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Union, Monarch Mill, Carlisle, Rose Hill State Park, Chester State Park, Leeds, Tuckertown and Santuc. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for Upstate South Carolina.
